text: Full list: Michigan State recruits (with highlights) Michigan State's football and basketball recruits for the 2016 and 2017 classes. Post to Facebook Full list: Michigan State recruits (with highlights) Michigan State's football and basketball recruits for the 2016 and 2017 classes.  //on.freep.com/1s4fu6V   Full list: Michigan State recruits (with highlights) Detroit Free Press Staff Published 9:43 p.m. ET Sept. 15, 2014 | Updated 34 minutes ago Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Here's a look at Michigan State's 2017 football recruiting class, starting with Emmanuel Flowers, a three-star cornerback from Chino Hills (Calif.) Ayala who picked MSU on Signing Day over Boise State, Colorado and UCLA. Courtesy of Ayala High Laress Nelson is a two-star wide receiver from Plantation (Fla.) American Heritage. Courtesy of American Heritage High Laress Nelson is listed at 5-feet-8 and 172 pounds. Courtesy of American Heritage High Laress Nelson also reportedly had scholarship offers from Northern Illinois, Miami (Ohio) and Middle Tennessee. Courtesy of American Heritage High Noah Harvey (7) is a two-star outside linebacker from Hartland (Wis.) Arrowhead. He is expected to grayshirt at MSU in 2017. Courtesy of Arrowhead High Noah Harvey (7) is listed at 6-feet-3 and 220 pounds. He also reportedly had scholarship offers from Northern Illinois, Bowling Green and Buffalo, among others. Courtesy of Arrowhead High C.J. Hayes is a three-star athlete from Bowling Green (Ky.) South Warren. Courtesy of Grace Photography C.J. Hayes is listed at 6-feet-3 and 200 pounds and flipped his commitment from Purdue. He also reportedly had scholarship offers from BYU, Nebraska and Virginia, among others. Courtesy of Grace Photography Connor Heyward is a three-star athlete from Suwanee (Ga.) Peachtree Ridge. Courtesy of Rick Fender Connor Heyward is listed at 6-feet-1 and 200 pounds. He's rated the No. 99 prospect in Georgia. Courtesy of Rick Fender Connor Heyward is the son of late NFL star Craig (Ironhead) Heyward and younger brother of Pittsburgh Steelers defensive lineman Cameron Heyward. Courtesy of Rick Fender Connor Heyward also reportedly had scholarship offers from Arizona State, Georgia Tech, Iowa and Louisville, among others. Courtesy of Rick Fender Jack Camper is a three-star tight end from Bradenton (Fla.) IMG Academy. Courtesy of IMG Academy Jack Camper was the second player to commit to MSU's 2017 class. Courtesy of IMG Academy Jack Camper is listed at 6-feet-4 and 225 pounds. Courtesy of IMG Academy Jack Camper also reportedly had scholarship offers from Georgia, Nebraska and Purdue, among others. Courtesy of IMG Academy DeAri Todd is a two-star defensive end from Lorain (Ohio) Clearview. Courtesy of Clearview High DeAri Todd is listed at 6-feet-4 and 230 pounds. He's considered a weakside defensive end. Courtesy of Clearview High DeAri Todd flipped is commitment from Boston College to Michigan State in late January. Courtesy of Clearview High DeAri Todd also reportedly had scholarship offers from Cincinnati and Central Michigan, among others. Courtesy of Clearview High Atlanta Westlake's Tre Person is a two-star cornerback. Branden Camp Atlanta Journal Constitution Ann Arbor Pioneer four-star linebacker Antjuan Simmons decommited from Ohio State in December, then chose the Spartans over the Buckeyes, Notre Dame and Arizona. Wright Wilson, Special to the DFP Fullscreen Antjuan Simmons is 6 feet 1 and 215 pounds. At linebacker in 2016, he tallied 73 tackles (43 solo, three for loss), two INTs and blocked two field goals. In 2015, he had 65 tackles, eight for loss, and one forced fumble. Chris Solari, DFP Antjuan Simmons is a two-time Free Press Dream Team member, gaining 1,112 yards on 148 carries with 18 TDs in 2015. He had 73 rushes for 433 yards and two TDs in 2016. Courtesy of Rivals.com Mustafa Khaleefah, above, is a three-star offensive tackle from Dearborn. Salwan Georges, DFP Mustafa Khaleefah is listed at 6-feet-6 and 285 pounds. He's ranked the No. 20 recruit in Michigan by rivals.com. Salwan Georges, DFP Mustafa Khaleefah also reportedly had scholarship offers from Cincinnati, Syracuse and a bunch of MAC schools. Salwan Georges, DFP Mustafa Khaleefah received a scholarship offer from MSU after working out at two camps in East Lansing in June 2016. Salwan Georges, DFP Dominique Long is a three-star safety from Westerville (Ohio) South. Courtesy of Westerville South Dominique Long is listed at 6-feet-2 and 185 pounds and also reportedly had scholarship offers from a slew of MAC schools. Courtesy of Rivals.com Jordan Reid is a three-star offensive lineman from Detroit Cass Tech. Ryan Garza, DFP Jordan Reid, right, is listed at 6-feet-4 and 284 pounds. Ryan Garza, DFP Jordan Reid also reportedly had scholarship offers from Arizona, Florida, Michigan, Nebraska and Tennessee, among others. Ryan Garza, DFP Jordan Reid is considered to be a guard prospect for college football. Mark Snyder, DFP Matt Dotson is a four-star tight end from Cincinnati Moeller. Sam Greene, Cincinnati Enquirer Matt Dotson is listed at 6-feet-5 and 226 pounds. He is ranked by rivals.com as the No. 4 tight end and the No. 189 overall player in the country. Cincinnati Enquirer Matt Dotson also reportedly had scholarship offers from Auburn, Florida, Michigan, Ohio State, Oregon, Penn State and Tennessee, among others. Mark Snyder, DFP Fairfield (Ohio) cornerback Josiah Scott, a three-star prospect, committed verbally on July 31, 2016. The 5-foot-10, 165-pounder also reportedly had scholarship offers from Iowa, Pittsburgh and West Virginia, among others. Courtesy of rivals.com Lashawn Paulino is a three-star weakside defensive end from Ft. Lauderdale St. Thomas Aquinas. The 6-foot-3, 230-pound prospect also reportedly had scholarship offers from Georgia, Mississippi State and Notre Dame, among others. Courtesy of Tom Martinez, STA Jacub Panasiuk, right, is a three-star defensive end from Roselle (Ill.) Lake Park. At left is Panasiuk's brother, Mike, a freshman for MSU this season. Courtesy of Panasiuk family Darien Clemons is a three-star athlete from Piqua, Ohio. Courtesy of Piqua High Darien Clemons is listed at 6-feet-1 and 210 pounds. Courtesy of Piqua High Darien Clemons also reportedly had scholarship offers from Rutgers and a host of MAC teams, including Central Michigan and Eastern Michigan. Courtesy of Piqua High Hunter Rison is a four-star wide receiver from Ann Arbor Skyline. Courtesy of Skyline High Hunter Rison is ranked by rivals.com as the No. 6 prospect in Michigan, No. 219 in the nation and the No. 35 wide receiver. Courtesy of Skyline High Hunter Rison is listed at 5 feet 11 and 190 pounds. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Hunter Rison, the son of MSU receiving great Andre Rison, also reportedly had scholarship offers from Alabama, Ohio State, Oklahoma, Oregon, Penn State and Texas A&M, among others. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Weston Bridges is a three-star running back from Copley, Ohio. Courtesy of Copley High Weston Bridges is listed at 6-feet-1 and 200 pounds. Courtesy of Copley High Weston Bridges is ranked the No. 29 running back in the country and the No. 23 overall recruit in Ohio by rivals.com. Courtesy of Copley High Weston Bridges also reportedly had scholarship offers from Boston College, Indiana, Missouri, Purdue and Rutgers, among others. Courtesy of Copley High Matt Carrick is a three-star offensive guard from Massillon (Ohio) Perry. He's listed at 6-feet-4 and 320 pounds. Courtesy of Perry High Matt Carrick also reportedly had scholarship offers from Iowa State and a host of MAC schools. Courtesy of Perry High Kevin Jarvis is a four-star offensive guard from Park Ridge (Ill.) Maine South. He's listed at 6-feet-5 and 315 pounds and also reportedly had scholarship offers from Auburn, Florida, Michigan, Mississippi State and Tennessee, among others. Photo courtesy of Rivals.com Cody White is a three-star wide receiver from Walled Lake Western. Courtesy of Rivals Cody White (7) is listed at 6-feet-3 and 190 pounds. Julian H. Gonzalez DFP Cody White is ranked the No. 12 prospect in Michigan and the No. 74 wide receiver in the nation by rivals.com. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Cody White also reportedly had scholarship offers from Duke, Iowa, Northwestern and Wisconsin, among others. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Rocky Lombardi is a three-star pro-style quarterback from West Des Moines (Iowa) Valley. He's listed at 6-feet-3 and 220 pounds. Merle Laswell, Des Moines Register Rocky Lombardi also reportedly had scholarship offers from Iowa, Iowa State and Virginia, among others. Courtesy of Des Moines Register Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
